comments:
We have a wacky file structure in our project which may be triggering this 
problem.  See the info on this listed below the error description.
----------
1. I import one of my classes (doesn't matter which one) into a scrapbook 
page.  In this case it was 
us.nc.state.enr.common.GlobalSharedObject.TableView.  TableView is not an inner 
class, GlobalSharedObject is a package (hey, I didn't name it).

2. Display results of 
TableView tv = new TableView();

3. Gives this error
An exception occurred during evaluation:  java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError

4. Error stack:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
us/nc/state/enr/common/GlobalSharedObject/TableView
	at CodeSnippet_1.run(CodeSnippet_1.java:4)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.snippeteditor.ScrapbookMain1.eval
(ScrapbookMain1.java:14)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.snippeteditor.ScrapbookMain.evalLoop
(ScrapbookMain.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.snippeteditor.ScrapbookMain.main
(ScrapbookMain.java:29)
----------
File structure:

d:\wlserver
    \config\IBEAM
        \applications\wm\WEB-INF\classes
        \serverclasses\
    \src\IBEAM
        \applications\wm\WEB-INF\classes
        \serverclasses
        \replicatedresources\classes
a. it matters not wether the class is from applications, replicatedresources or 
serverclasses -- still get the error.
b. our webserver is WebLogic (not that that matters) which can handle this file 
structure.
c. our build script compiles from the replicated resources and copies those 
classes into each application (just a note, that shouldn't effect the problem)
----------
.classpath file:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<classpath>
    <classpathentry kind="src" output="config/IBEAM/serverclasses" 
path="src/IBEAM/serverclasses"/>
    <classpathentry kind="src"
        output="config/IBEAM/applications/wm/web-inf/classes" 
path="src/IBEAM/replicatedresources/classes"/>
    <classpathentry kind="src"
        output="config/IBEAM/applications/wm/web-inf/classes" 
path="src/IBEAM/applications/wm/WEB-INF/classes"/>
    <classpathentry exported="true" kind="con" 
path="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JRE_CONTAINER"/>
    <classpathentry exported="true" kind="lib" 
path="D:/bea/weblogic7/server/lib/weblogic.jar"/>
    <classpathentry exported="true" kind="lib" 
path="D:/bea/weblogic7/server/lib/classes12.zip"/>
    <classpathentry kind="lib" path="src/IBEAM/Ext_Dir/jars/java-getopt-
1.0.8.jar"/>
    <classpathentry kind="lib" path="src/IBEAM/Ext_Dir/jars/jcert.jar"/>
    <classpathentry kind="lib" path="src/IBEAM/Ext_Dir/jars/jnet.jar"/>
    <classpathentry kind="lib" path="src/IBEAM/Ext_Dir/jars/jsse.jar"/>
    <classpathentry kind="lib" 
path="src/IBEAM/Ext_Dir/jars/arcims_jconnect.jar"/>
    <classpathentry kind="output" path="config/IBEAM/default"/>
</classpath>

Is the class defined in the same project, or a pre-req project of the scrapbook 
page?

The scrapbook page is saved in the root directory of the project (wlserver)  
Should I put it down in the class' source directory?  Let me know and I'll try 
it on my system.

The location of the page itself should not matter - as long as it is in the 
project that contains a classpath that can see the class in question. Can you 
create a simple reproduceable example of the problem (i.e. create a new project 
with a single class, and see if the problem exists)?

Created an attachment (id=5894)
A zip file of a simplified version of my configuration.

I've created a simplified version of my configuration.	In this version the
class is called ScrapTest.  I cannot instantiate it in the scrapbook pages
(page1, page2).

Note: In the attached example I forgot to import ScrapTest, however the problem 
does persist after you import it.

Using the latest 3.0 integration build (I20030827 - also known as M3), this 
works for me. When I import the type, or reference it fully qualified, the 
snippet page works. Can you verify this works on the latest build? (or are you 
tied to a 2.1 Eclipse?)
I verified the problem exists on 2.1, but not on 3.0.

This also works in 2.1.1 (but I can't find a bug number that shows it was 
fixed). I recommend upgrading to 2.1.1.
Verified this works in 2.1.1 and 3.0 builds

OK, Unfortunately I have to stay with 2.1.0 due to problems with migrating the 
WebLogic plugin.
